cma::CTypeTokenizer

Detailed Description

Tokenizer tokenizes a raw input string in specific encoding to a sequence of characters.

Tokenizer tokenizes a raw input string in specific encoding to a sequence of characters. Typically, the usage is like below:

// create instance of encoding type CMA_CType* ctype = CMA_CType_GB2312::instance();

// create instance of Tokenizer Tokenizer tokenizer(*ctype);

// set the raw input string tokenizer.assign("...");

// get each character for(const char* p=tokenizer.next(); p; p=tokenizer.next()) { // print the character cout << p << endl; }

void cma::CTypeTokenizer::assign ( const char *  str  ) 

Set a raw input string.

Parameters:
str pointer to the raw input string
Attention:
The raw input string should be encoded in ctype of Constructor. As Tokenizer doesn't make a copy of str, the caller must ensure the life time of str in the calling of next() afterward.

Referenced by cma::CMA_WType::getWordType().

const char * cma::CTypeTokenizer::next (  ) 

Get the next character in specific encoding.

Returns:
pointer to the next character
Attention:
0 is returned if there is no character left.
